questions.question: For Data Providers, which statement is correct?
answers: The provided data must be necessarily anonymized.
Data must be made available in a specific format.
Once access conditions are defined by the provider, they cannot be modified.
The provider must initiate an on-chain transaction to input metadata and rules.

questions.question: What kind of models can AI builders share?
answers: Foundation models.
Any kind of model.
Only models governed by a DAO.
Only open-source models.

questions.question: What is the main reason for Service Providers to lock tokens on services?
answers: To guarantee the integrity of services.
To give free access to services.
To offer a reduction of fees.
To permit flexibility of services.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true?
answers: In the execution of a workflow, there can be multiple consumers and providers.
The only consumer is the entity that initiates the workflow with an on-chain transaction.
In the execution of a workflow, providers must perform an on-chain transaction.
All entities that use or will use the output of the workflow execution are considered consumers.

questions.question: Which of these statements is false?
answers: Within Axone, the same entity can be both a consumer and a provider.
If a consumer uses a Third-party identity service like Sign-in with Google, they will not have their own ID when interacting with the protocol.
If a company uses Axone to build its XaaS, the company's clients will not necessarily interact with the protocol as consumers.
Within the same workflow, the same entity can be both a consumer and a provider.
